main_definition: Revisions refer to the act of reviewing, altering, or modifying a written work, document, plan, or other entity in order to improve it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changes made to a draft version of something (e.g., text, design) before finalizing
meanings_and_examples.example: The author had several revisions done on her manuscript by an editor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Improvements or corrections in the accuracy and quality of something after reviewing it
meanings_and_examples.example: After peer reviews, the research paper required numerous revisions to meet publication standards.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adjustments made during a process or activity for better outcomes
meanings_and_examples.example: The team had several design revisions to ensure the final product met user needs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Modifications in legal contracts, agreements or terms before they are ratified
meanings_and_examples.example: Both parties agreed on a series of important revisions for their business partnership agreement.
